revised_title: Discovery of a Gigantic Land-Lizard in Australia
tldr: The author, Richard Owen, describes the discovery of a gigantic land-lizard fossil, Megalania prisca, from Australia. This extinct species had a length of at least twenty feet and was larger than the largest species known at the time. The fossil remains were part of a collection acquired by the British Museum. Owen compares the vertebrae of Megalania with those of recent and extinct Sauria and provides illustrations of the vertebrae of Megalania and Hydrosaurus.
